thread.title: McLaren supercar worth £215k EXPLODES into monster fireball
thread.title_full: McLaren supercar worth £215k EXPLODES into monster fireball

title: McLaren supercar worth £215k EXPLODES into monster fireball
text:
CATERS ON FIRE: The shocking moment was caught on camera 
Black smoke smothered the area when the white 650S Spider model set on fire with a tank full of petrol on Blyth Road, Lincoln at 12.20pm on Sunday. 
The female motorist, who was lucky to escape without any injuries, returned to the burning vehicle which could have “exploded at any time” to get her shopping. 
Emergency services raced to save the flashy wheels but the swanky supercar was left in tatters and the bodywork had melted away. 
CATERS CHAOS: Black smoke choked the roads as the car was burning Supercars of London Tuesday, 29th March 2016 Britain’s flashiest tourist has arrived in London with a fleet of GOLD cars worth more than £1 million. The young man recently flew into the UK from Saudi Arabia with a number of his friends. But instead of taking the tube or taxis, he decided to fly a number of outlandish cars across for travelling around the capital 1 / 20 Tony Kershaw / SWNS A gold Lamborghini Huracan pictured outside of the Dorchester Hotel 
Shocked onlookers were quick to catch the monster inferno on camera in a series of vivid photographs. 
Eyewitness Becky Gagen, 45, who was out driving with husband John, 59, and their son Tom, 10, watched on as the McLaren was consumed by flames. 
Mrs Gagen, of Doncaster, South Yorks., said: "We could see black smoke in the distance, and as we turned around the corner there was a blazing McLaren right in front of us. 
CATERS MONSTER FLAMES: The vehicle could have 'exploded at any time' “It had a full tank of petrol and could have exploded at any moment” Eyewitness Becky Gagen 
"There was a female driver at the side of the road. What made us laugh was the fact that she'd got her shopping out of the car and emptied it – making sure that dinner was in the bag was obviously her first priority. 
"She shouted at us to stay away as it had a full tank of petrol and could have exploded at any moment." 
The road was closed for 30 minutes as emergency services put out the fire. The hottest concepts and supercars of 2016 Thursday, 16th June 2016 The hottest concepts of the future and supercars of 2016, including Porsche Mission-E, the Bugatti Chiron and the Lamborghini Centenario. 1 / 57 BMW To celebrate its centenary year, BMW Group has today unveiled three ‘vision vehicles’ that represent how we will travel in the next 100 years 
A Nottinghamshire Fire and Rescue Service spokesman said: "Firefighters from Harworth Fire Station were called to a car fire on Blyth Road, near to Blyth at 12.13pm on 19 February. 
"One hose reel jet, two breathing apparatus and a dry powder fire extinguisher were used to put out the fire, and the incident had been dealt with by 12.48pm." Related articles
